contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox company | company_name = QuikCycle, Inc. | company_logo = <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image: QuikCycleLogo.gif|120px]] -->| company_type = [[Private company|Privately held]]| foundation = 2000 (as Lumenaré Networks) | location = [[Santa Clara, California]] | industry = [[Telecommunications]],<br> [[computer software|Software]],<br> Lab and [[Test automation]] | slogan = Testing Without Limits | products = [[Broadband]] and [[internet]] products and services,<br> [[IP Multimedia Subsystem|IMS]] products and services,<br> [[IPTV]] products and services,<br> [[Information Technology|IT]] and [[computer network|network]] solutions,<br> [[Telecommunications service|Telecommunications]] products and services, <br>[[VoIP]] products and services| num_employees = 60 | homepage = [http://www.QuikCycle.com QuikCycle]}} '''QuikCycle, Inc.''' (formerly '''Lumenaré Networks''') is a [[Santa Clara, California]]-based developer of lab automation and test management solutions.<ref>{{cite news | title=New Products | date=2007-05-15 | url =http://www.sdtimes.com/article/story-20070515-30.html | work =Software Development Times | accessdate = 2007-07-10 }}</ref> QuikCycle's [[computer software|software]] allows for complete test lifecycle management and is in use by [[telecommunications Service Provider|telecommunications]] and [[Cable television|cable]] service providers, [[telecommunications network|network]] equipment manufacturers, enterprises, and [[storage area network]] (SAN) providers around the world.<ref>{{cite news | title=QuikCycle Website | url =http://www.QuikCycle.com | accessdate = 2007-07-11 }}</ref> The Company’s software automates manual steps in the pre-production testing of new network services (including [[Internet Protocol|IP]]-based services such as [[VoIP]] and [[IPTV]]), infrastructure upgrades and network devices.<ref>{{cite news | title=Santa Clara-Based Lumenare Networks Changes Name, Lands $8.9 Million in Funding | date=2007-03-14 | url= http://www.siliconvalleywire.com/svw/2007/03/santa_clarabase_3.html | work =Silicon Valley Wire | accessdate = 2007-07-10 }}</ref> ==Company history== QuikCycle is headquartered in Santa Clara, CA and has [[Research and development|R&D]] centers in the US and [[India]]. The company was formerly known as Lumenaré Networks, a provider of automated remote access network equipment for the purpose of training, network design, [[product demonstration]]s, integration testing and qualification, and equipment provisioning.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pulse.tiaonline.org/article.cfm?id=222 |title=Member Highlights |accessdate=2007-07-11 |work=TIA PulseOnline }}</ref> In March 2007, the company announced its name change to QuikCycle, as well as the closing of an $8.9 million round of new funding from [[Venture capital]] firm Crescendo Ventures.<ref>{{cite news | title=QuikCycle, Lab Automation Software Co., Raises $8.9M | date=2007-03-13 | url =http://venturebeat.com/2007/03/13/quikcycle-lab-automation-software-co-raises-89m/ | work =Venture Beat | accessdate = 2007-07-10}}</ref> ==References== <div class='references-small'> <references/> </div> ==External links== <div class='references-small'> * [http://www.crescendoventures.com/portfolio_quikcycle.html/ Crescendo Portfolio Companies] * [http://www.bitpipe.com/detail/RES/1181321684_141.html?asrc=RSS_BP_BLATTELECOMM/ Lab Automation and Test Management Whitepaper] * [http://www.tmcnet.com/usubmit/2007/06/20/2728149.htm/ TMC Labs Innovation Award Winners Announced by Internet Telephony] * [http://www.v2oipqualityalliance.org/ V2oIP Quality Alliance Website] * [http://www.von.com/2007/spring_sanJose/schedule_gcss1168014704.html/ VON Conference & Expo Session: Accelerate New Product and Service Delivery from Lab to Live] * [http://www.crescendoventures12.com/ Crescendo Ventures Detailed Portfolio] </div> [[Category:Software companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in Santa Clara, California]] [[Category:Broadband]] [[Category:VoIP services]]
